meanings.definition: To make a sound expressing disdain or annoyance.
meanings.sent1: She was humphing loudly when her brother took her toy.
meanings.sent2: The child kept humphing every time his mom asked him to clean his room.
meanings.sent3: After humphing at the rainy weather, she decided to stay indoors and read a book.
meanings.sent4: The cat humphed at the new food in its bowl before walking away.
meanings.sent5: The old man humphed as he struggled to lift the heavy box.

meanings.definition: A noise made to show disapproval or irritation.
meanings.sent1: The teacher heard a loud humphing from the back of the classroom.
meanings.sent2: His humphing could be heard across the room, expressing his frustration.
meanings.sent3: The humphing of the audience grew louder as the magician's trick failed.
meanings.sent4: The humphing of the engine indicated a problem that needed fixing.
meanings.sent5: The humphing of the wind through the trees added to the eerie atmosphere of the forest.
